pr_title: Add a method to check if a name or a signature is Qtype

timeline.bodyText: do the full NULL != utfWrapper check here
timeline.author: tajila

timeline.bodyText: also if braces are on the same line if (NULL != utfWrapper) { if its a one condition if statement
timeline.author: tajila

timeline.bodyText: do you still have any use for isClassRefQtype? it was added for the JIT. If it is not longer needed you can remove it from the table
timeline.author: tajila
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -376,6 +376,7 @@ J9InternalVMFunctions J9InternalFunctions = {
 #endif /* J9VM_OPT_JITSERVER */
 	createJoinableThreadWithCategory,
 	valueTypeCapableAcmp,
+	isNameOrSignatureQtype,
 	isClassRefQtype,

replies.bodyText:
isClassRefQtype is used in JIT such as in the following places:
https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/blob/5d43290a25c5b29c3c2b0571b862820877013b70/runtime/compiler/ilgen/Walker.cpp#L2378
https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/blob/5d43290a25c5b29c3c2b0571b862820877013b70/runtime/compiler/ilgen/IlGenerator.cpp#L570
replies.author: a7ehuo

timeline.message:
Add a method to check if a name or a signature is Qtype

Signed-off-by: Annabelle Huo <Annabelle.Huo@ibm.com>

timeline.author: tajila

timeline.bodyText: and here, it should have been added the first time
timeline.author: tajila
gacholio
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -2333,6 +2333,17 @@ classPrepareWithWithUnflattenedFlattenables(J9VMThread *currentThread, J9Class *
 BOOLEAN
 valueTypeCapableAcmp(J9VMThread *currentThread, j9object_t lhs, j9object_t rhs);
 
+/**
+ * Determines if a name or a signature pointed by a J9UTF8 pointer is a Qtype.
+ *
+ * @param[in] utfWrapper J9UTF8 pointer that points to the name or the signature
+ *
+ * @return TRUE if the name or the signature pointed by the J9UTF8 pointer is a Qtype, false otherwise
